Vanderwaltozyma japonica (ja.poni.ca. N.L. fem. adj. japonica, referring to Japan, where seven strains were discovered).

On YM agar, after 3 weeks at 25 C, the cells are ellipsoidal to elongated (1438 m), elongating to 24 m and occurring singly, in pairs or in short chains (Fig. 2a). Budding is multi-lateral. On YM agar, after 3 days at 25 C, colonies are cream-coloured, butyrous, glistening and smooth. No hyphae or pseudohyphae are observed using the Dalmau plate method after 2 weeks on cornmeal agar at 25 C. Ascospores are globose to short ellipsoidal (2323 m) with two or three in the deliquescent, unconjugated ascus on acetate agar, at 15 C for 3 weeks (Fig. 2b). Glucose and galactose are fermented, whereas sucrose, maltose, lactose, raffinose, trehalose, xylose and cellobiose are not. The carbon compounds assimilated include glucose, galactose, d-gluconate and d-glucono-1,5-lactone. No growth occurs on l-sorbose, sucrose, maltose, cellobiose, trehalose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, melezitose, inulin, soluble starch, d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, d-ribose, l-rhamnose, ethanol, glycerol, erythritol, ribitol, galactitol (dulcitol), mannitol, glucitol, -methyl-d-glucoside, salicin, dl-lactate, succinate, citrate, inositol, arbutin, d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, 2-keto-d-gluconate, 5-keto-d-gluconate, hexadecane, methanol, propane-1,2-diol, butane-2,3-diol, xylitol, d-glucuronate, d-galacturonate and arabinitol (arabitol). Assimilation of nitrogen compounds is positive for ammonium sulphate and negative for nitrate, nitrite, ethylamine, lysine, cadaverine and imidazole. Growth at 30 C is positive, whereas growth at 35, 37 and 40 C is negative. No growth is observed in a broth containing 5% glucose and 10% sodium chloride. There was no growth on a medium containing 50% glucose and 0.5% yeast extract. No growth occurs when exposed to 0.1 or 0.01% cycloheximide. Growth occurs in a vitamin-free medium. The holotype, designated as NBRC 11078T, is preserved in a metabolically inactive state at the Biological Resource Center of the National Institute of Technology and Evaluation (NBRC) in Chiba, Japan. The isotype strain TBRC 19102T has been deposited at the Thailand Bioresource Research Center (TBRC), National Center for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology, Thailand. The MycoBank number is MB 855476. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the D1/D2 domains of the LSU rRNA gene, ITS region and mitochondrial COX II of the type strain NBRC 11078T are LC819108, LC819115 and LC819122, respectively.
Description of Vanderwaltozyma japonica Shibayama, Miyazaki, Moriya and Yamaguchi sp. nov.Description of Olsenella absiana sp. nov.
Olsenella absiana (ab.si.ana. N.L. fem. adj. absiana, arbitrary adjective formed by the ABS Research Support Center at KRIBB).

Obligate anaerobic, Gram-stain-positive, non-motile and non-spore-forming. Cells growing on RCM blood plates are short-rod-shaped, 0.60.7 m in diameter and 1.11.4 m long. The species tolerance of NaCl is up to 2% (w/v). Cells grow in the range 3040 C, with optimal growth at 37 C; cells grow at pH 4.59, with optimal growth at pH 7. Based on the API ZYM, the strain is positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase, esterase lipase, valine arylamidase, crystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphtol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, -galactosidase and -glucosidase, but negative for lipase, leucine arylamidase, -chymotrypsin, -galactosidase, -glucuronidase, -glucosidase, N-acetyl--glucosaminidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase. Based on the API 20A test strip, the strain is positive for glucose, sucrose, maltose, salicin, xylose, arabinose, gelatin and mannose, but negative for mannitol, lactose, glycerol, cellobiose, melezitose, raffinose, sorbitol, rhamnose and trehalose. Aesculin is hydrolyzed, while indole and urease are not produced. The end products are lactic acid and acetic acid. C18:0 DMA, C18:1 9c DMA and C18:1 9c are the main cellular fatty acids. The cell wall peptidoglycans contain meso-diaminopimelic acid. The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 68.6 mol%.

The type strain YH-ols2223T (=KCTC 25800T = NBRC 116680T) was isolated from a pig faeces specimen on a pig farm. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of YH-ols2223T is PP514387, and that for the genome sequence is JAZGJQ000000000.
Description of Olsenella absiana sp. nov.Description of Aurantiacibacter flavus sp. nov.
Aurantiacibacter flavus sp. nov. (flavus. L. masc. adj. flavus, pale yellow)

Cells are Gram-stain-negative, non-motile, rod-shaped, facultatively anaerobic and ~1.081.230.460.60 m in size. The catalase reaction was positive, while the oxidase reaction was negative. The strain was cultured on MA at 30 C for 4 days, and the colonies were observed to be convex, with entire margins, circular, smooth and yellowish-coloured. The cells grew well on MA but weakly on Reasoners 2A and LuriaBertani agars. The cells grew between 7 and 45 C, at a pH range of 6.010.0 and in the presence of 011.0% NaCl. Optimal growth conditions were observed at 2530 C, pH 7.08.0 and in the presence of 2.0% NaCl. The cells were hydrolysed by Tween 20 and Tween 80. In the API 20NE test, positive reactions were observed for aesculin, 4-nitrophenyl--d-galactopyranside and the reduction of nitrates to nitrites. The major fatty acids observed were C17:1 6c and summed feature 8. The major polar lipids were DPG, PG and SGL. The major respiratory quinone was Q-10. Strain DGU5T (= KACC 23720T = TBRC 19015T) was isolated from the mudflat of S. japonica colonies in Incheon, Republic of Korea. The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.5%.
The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ/PIR accession numbers of the whole-genome shotgun sequences and 16S rRNA sequences are JBDLBR000000000 and PP504484, respectively.
Description of Aurantiacibacter flavus sp. nov.Description of Aurantiacibacter gilvus sp. nov.
Aurantiacibacter gilvus sp. nov. (gilvus. L. masc. adj. gilvus, yellow)

Cells are Gram-stain-negative, non-motile, rod-shaped, facultatively anaerobic and ~1.291.400.500.53 m in size. The catalase reaction was positive, while the oxidase reaction was negative. The strains were cultured on MA at 30 C for 4 days, and the colonies were observed to be convex, with entire margins, circular, smooth and yellowish-coloured. The cells grow well on MA but weakly on Reasoners 2A, nutrient, and LuriaBertani agar mediums. The strain grew at temperatures between 1045 C, at a pH range of 3.010.0 and in the presence of 011.0% NaCl. Optimal growth conditions were at 3035 C, pH 7.08.0 and 2.0% NaCl. The cells were hydrolysed by Tween 80 only. In the API 20NE test, positive reactions were observed for aesculin, 4-nitrophenyl--d-galactopyranside and the reduction of nitrates to nitrites. The major fatty acids were C17:1 6c and summed feature 8. The major polar lipids were DPG, PG and SGL. The major respiratory quinone was Q-10.

Strain DGU6T (= KACC 23721T = TBRC 19016T) was isolated from the mudflat of S. japonica colonies in Incheon, Republic of Korea. The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.5%. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ/PIR accession numbers of the whole-genome shotgun sequences and 16S rRNA sequences are JBBYHV000000000 and PP504315, respectively.
Description of Aurantiacibacter gilvus sp. nov.Description of Roseovarius phycicola sp. nov.
Roseovarius phycicola (phy.cico.la. L. n. phycos, seaweed; L. suffix. -cola (from L. masc./fem. n. incola), an inhabitant of a place; N.L. masc. n. phycicola, an inhabitant of seaweed).

Colonies on MA are circular, convex, smooth and greyish yellow in colour. Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic, and non-motile rods (0.71.0 m in width and 1.01.6 m in length), demonstrating oxidase- and catalase-positive activities. Growth occurs at 2030 C (optimum, 25 C) and pH 6.09.0 (optimum, pH 8.0) and in the presence of 2.05.0% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 3.0%). Nitrate reduction, indole production and d-glucose fermentation are negative. Aesculin is hydrolysed, but casein, Tween 20, Tween 80, tyrosine, starch and gelatin are not. Urease and arginine dihydrolase activities are negative. Assimilation of N-acetylglucosamine, malic acid, d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-maltose, gluconate and adipic acid is positive, but assimilation of d-mannitol, phenylacetic acid, capric acid and citric acid is negative. Q-10 is the sole respiratory quinone, and major cellular fatty acids (>5%) are summed feature 8 (comprising C18:1 7c and/or C18:1 6c), C16:0 and C16:0-2OH. PG, PC, an AL, a PL and two Ls are detected as major polar lipids.

The type strain is S88T (=KACC 23423T =JCM 36647T), isolated from a marine red alga L. hakodatensis. The total genome size and DNA G+C content calculated from the whole-genome (a chromosome and a plasmid) sequence of the type strain are 3637 kb and 57.0%, respectively. The GenBank accession numbers of the 16S rRNA gene and genome sequences of S88T are OR431746 and CP146069CP146070, respectively.
Description of Roseovarius phycicola sp. nov.Description of Roseovarius rhodophyticola sp. nov.

Roseovarius rhodophyticola (rho.do.phy.tico.la. N.L. neut. pl. n. Rhodophyta, the division of the red algae; L. suffix. -cola (from L. masc./fem. n. incola), an inhabitant of a place; N.L. masc. n. rhodophyticola, inhabitant of Rhodophyta).

Colonies on MA are circular, convex, smooth and greyish yellow in colour. Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic and non-motile rods (0.60.7 m in width and 0.92.0 m in length), demonstrating oxidase- and catalase-positive activities. Growth occurs at 2030 C (optimum, 25 C) and pH 7.09.0 (optimum, pH 8.0) and in the presence of 2.05.0% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 3.0%). Nitrate reduction, indole production and d-glucose fermentation are negative. Aesculin is hydrolysed, but casein, Tween 20, Tween 80, tyrosine, starch and gelatin are not. Urease and arginine dihydrolase activities are negative. Assimilation of l-arabinose, d-maltose, citric acid, phenylacetic acid and adipic acid is positive, but assimilation of d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, gluconate, N-acetylglucosamine, malic acid and capric acid is negative. Q-10 is the sole respiratory quinone, and major cellular fatty acids (>5%) are summed feature 8 (comprising C18:1 7c and/or C18:1 6c) and C16:0. PG, PC, an AL, a PL and an L are detected as major polar lipids.

The type strain is W115T =KACC 23690T =JCM 36651T), isolated from a marine red alga S. dubyi. The total genome size and DNA G+C content calculated from the whole genome (a chromosome and two plasmids) sequence of the type strain are 3717 kb and 56.5%, respectively. The GenBank accession numbers of the 16S rRNA gene and genome sequences of strain W115T are OR431747 and CP146606CP146607, respectively.
Description of Roseovarius rhodophyticola sp. nov.Description of Bifidobacterium Favimelis sp. nov.
Bifidobacterium favimelis (fa.vi.me'lis. L. masc. n. favus, a honeycomb; L. neut. n. mel, honey; N.L. gen. n. favimelis, of comb honey).

Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.40.60.81.4 m, that usually occur singly or in pairs. Colonies on mMRS agar are circular, translucent, convex and ~1.0 mm in diameter after 72 h cultivation at 35 C under strict anaerobic conditions. In mMRS broth, cells can grow at 2042 C (optimum 35 C) and at pH 59 (optimum pH 6). F6PPK-positive. In the API 50CHL test, acid is produced from d-ribose, amygdalin, maltose, lactose (weak), melibiose, sucrose, raffinose, starch, glycogen and gentiobiose (weak); acid is not produced from glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl -d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl -d-mannopyranoside, methyl -d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, xylitol, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate and 5-keto-gluconate. Aesculin is hydrolysed. In the API ZYM test, it is positive for leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase (weak), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, -galactosidase, -galactosidase, -glucosidase, -glucosidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase; negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, trypsin, -chymotrypsin, -glucuronidase and N-acetyl--glucosaminidase. The major cellular fatty acids detected are C16:0, C18:1 9c and Sum in Feature 7 (C19:1 7c/C19:1 6c). The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of the A3 l-Lys-Gly type.
The type strain, IMAU50987T (= GDMCC 1.4189T = JCM 36315T), was isolated from black comb honey. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.5%.
Draft genome sequence accession number: JBANDZ000000000.
16S rRNA gene accession number: PP390173.
Description of Bifidobacterium Favimelis sp. nov.Description of Microbispora maris sp. nov.
Microbispora maris (maris. L. gen. n. maris, of the sea, denoting the source of the isolate)

Aerobic, Gram-stain-positive actinomycete that forms longitudinal pairs of spores branching from aerial hyphae. Nonmotile spores (0.921.08 m) are oval and the surface was smooth. Aerial spore mass colour is pale pink to pinkish white, white aerial mycelium is produced easily on ISP 2 and M8 agar medium, which displays good growth on ISP 2, ISP 3, M8 and ATCC 172 agars and moderate growth on ISP 1, ISP 5, ISP 6, ISP 7 and CA. However, weak growth is observed on ISP 4. The growth range is 1645 C (optimum, 2837 C) with a pH range of 3.09.0 (optimum, pH 7.0) in the presence of 02% (w/v) NaCl. Positive for the reduction of nitrate, hydrolysis of starch and oxidase activities, but negative for catalase, liquefaction of gelatin, milk coagulation, the production of H2S or melanin formation. Sucrose, maltose, d-xylose, d-fructose, myo-inositol and sorbitol are utilized as sole carbon sources, but not -lactose, l-rhamnose, raffinose, d-ribose and l-arabinose. l-Alanine, l-arginine, l-glutamine, l-proline and l-tyrosine are utilized as sole nitrogen sources, but not l-threonine or l-serine. Contains meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diagnostic diamino acid of the cell wall peptidoglycan. Madurose, glucose and ribose were detected in whole-cell hydrolysates. The menaquinones in the cells are MK-9(H6), MK-9(H4), MK-9(H2) and MK-9(H0). The polar lipid profile comprises PE, PI, DPG, PME, PIM, NPG and an unknown PL. The major cellular fatty acids (>10 %) are iso-C16:0 and iso-C18:0.

The type strain ZYX-F-249T (=CCTCC AA 2023030T =JCM 36778T) was isolated from the gill of the leopard coral grouper collected from Yongxing Island, Sansha, Hainan Province, China. The draft genome size of the type strain is 8.8 Mb, and genome sequencing shows a DNA G+C content of 71.6 %. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of Microbispora maris ZYX-F-249T is PP078609. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession number for the draft genome sequence of Microbispora maris ZYX-F-249T is JBDJAW000000000.
Description of Microbispora maris sp. nov.Description of Blastococcus montanus sp. nov.
Blastococcus montanus (mon.tanus. L. masc. adj. montanus, referring to a mountain, located in the Flaming Mountain of Xinjiang, PR China, the place from where the strain was isolated).

Cells are Gram-stain-positive, non-motile, catalase-positive, oxidase-negative and rod and coccoidelements with evidence of budding. The type strain HT6-4T is smooth and moist. Round orange colonies with entire margins are formed on R2A agar. Grows at 1037  (optimum 30 ), at pH 5.08.0 (optimum pH 7.0) and in the presence of 04% (w/v) NaCl. Glucose fermentation and indole production from tryptophan are not observed. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite and nitrogen. Activities of arginine dihydrolase, urease and GELatin are not present. In API ZYM tests, results for -glucosidase and -galactosidase are positive, whilst results for esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), trypsin, -chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, N-acetyl--glucosaminidase and -mannosidase are negative. According to the Biolog system, Tween 40, d-galactose, d-sorbitol and d-gluconic acid can be used as sole carbon sources but not acetic acid, adenosine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, dextrin, d-fructose, l-fucose, glycogen, l-glutamic acid, glycerol, -hydroxybutyric acid, -hydroxybutyric acid, -hydroxybutyric acid, inulin, d-mannose, melibiose, d-mannitol and methyl -d-glucoside. Whole-cell hydrolysates contain meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diagnostic diamino acid and ribose and galactose as diagnostic sugars. The predominant menaquinone is MK-9, with MK-8 as a minor component. Polar lipids consist of DPG, PG, PE, PC, PI, PL14, an unidentified amino lipid and two unidentified phospholipids. The fatty acid profile was characterized by significant amounts of iso-C16:0, C17:18c and C18:19c acids. Additional chemotaxonomic properties are typical of the genus.

The type strain, HT6-4T (=KCTC 59234T =GDMCC 1.4386T), was isolated from soil from the Flaming Mountain, Xinjiang, PR China. The DNA G+C content of type strain is 73.9 mol%. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the genome and 16S rRNA gene sequences of strain HT6-4T are CP155551 and PP767292, respectively.
Description of Blastococcus montanus sp. nov.Description of Alterisphingorhabdus gen. nov.

Alterisphingorhabdus (Al.te.ri.sphin.go.rhabdus. L. masc. adj. alter, another, other, different; N.L. fem. n. Sphingorhabdus, a bacterial generic name; N.L. fem. n. Alterisphingorhabdus, another or different Sphingorhabdus).

Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, oxidase- and catalase-positive and non-spore forming. Q-10 is the major respiratory quinone. The major fatty acids contain C18:1 7c and/or C18:1 6c, C16:0 and C14:0 2OH. Major polar lipids contain SP, PE, PG and PC.
The type species is Alterisphingorhabdus coralli.
Description of Alterisphingorhabdus gen. nov.Description of Alterisphingorhabdus coralli sp. nov.
Alterisphingorhabdus coralli (co.ralli. N.L. gen. n. coralli, of a coral, from which the type strain was isolated).

Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped, measuring 0.70.8 m in length and 0.50.6 m in width. Colonies are round, plump, smooth and orange when growing at 28  on MA medium for 1 week. The strain grows within a range of 2037 , pH 79 and 14% (w/v) NaCl, with optimum growth at 30 , pH 7 and 3% (w/v) NaCl. It is positive for catalase and oxidase, but negative for nitrate reduction and H2S production. It hydrolyses Tweens (20, 60 and 80) but not starch, cellulose, gelatin and Tween 40. Milk coagulation and peptonization are negative. Acetic acid, N-acetylglucosamine, acetoacetic acid and capric acid can be utilized as substrates for growth, but maltose, d-mannose, adipate, arabinose, glycerol, gluconate, inosine, d-mannitol, malic acid, citric acid and phenylacetic acid cannot be utilized. SP, PE, PG and PC are major polar lipids. The major respiratory quinone is Q-10. C18:1 7c and/or C18:1 6c, C16:0, C14:0 2OH, C17:1 6c and C18:1 7c 11-methyl are the major fatty acids, with C14:0 2OH as the predominant hydroxy fatty acids.

The type strain SCSIO 66989T (=MCCC 1K08014T=KCTC 92499T) was isolated from reef-building coral in Sanya, Hainan Province, China. The genomic G+C content is 57.0%. The whole-genome accession numbers are CP136594 and CP136595. The NCBI accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence is OR464167.
Description of Alterisphingorhabdus coralli sp. nov.Description of Starmerella fangiana Y.H. Wei, P.J. Han, D.Q. Wang & F.Y. Bai sp. nov.

Starmerella fangiana (fang.i.ana. N.L. fem. adj. fangiana, of Fang, named in honour of Xinfang Fang for his pioneering contributions to the study of yeasts associated with Daqu and Baijiu fermentation in China).

Culture characteristics: After growth on yeast extractmalt extract (YM) agar for 1 week at 25 C, the cells are ovoid to ellipsoidal (2.14.02.86.1 m) and occur singly or as budded pairs; reproduction is by multilateral budding (Fig. 2a). On YM agar after 3 days at 25 C, colonies are cream, opaque and smooth with the entire margin. After growth in YM broth for 1 month at 25 C, ring and sediment are formed. The true hyphae of strain D5S-2 formed on Dalmau plates after 1 month on PDA agar at 25 C (Fig. 2b). Pseudohyphae are not observed on Dalmau plates after 1 month on PDA agar and CMA agar at 25 C. Asci or signs of conjugation are not observed on YCB, CMA, PDA and V8 after 2 months at 25 C.

Physiological and biochemical characteristics: Glucose and sucrose fermentation are strong or delay. But trehalose, galactose, maltose, lactose and raffinose are not fermented. Glucose, d-galactose (or delay), l-sorbose, sucrose, raffinose, d-ribose (or weak), ethanol, glycerol, mannitol, glucitol, succinic acid (weak), xylitol (or weak) and citric acid (weak) are assimilated as sole carbon sources. d-maltose, d-cellobiose, trehalose, lactose, melibiose, melezitose, inulin, starch soluble, d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, l-rhamnose, d-glucosamine, methanol, erythritol, ribitol, galactitol, -methyl-d-glucoside, salicin, d-glucuronic acid, dl-lactic acid, inositol, hexadecane and N-acetyl-d-glucosamine are not assimilated as sole carbon sources. Ethylamine, cadaverine, ammonium sulphate, l-lysine and potassium nitrate (or delay) are assimilated as sole nitrogen sources. Sodium nitrite is not assimilated as sole nitrogen sources. Urease activity is negative. Diazonium blue B reaction is positive. Extracellular starch compounds are not produced. Growth in 10% (w/v) sodium chloride plus 5% (w/v) glucose medium is positive. Growth on 50% (w/v) glucoseyeast extract agar and 60% (w/v) glucoseyeast extract agar is positive. Growth in vitamin-free medium is positive. Growth on YPD agar is positive at 40 C but negative at 45 C.

The holotype, CGMCC 2.7773 (original strain number QFC-8), was isolated from dusts on windows of Daqu-making workshops collected in Zunyi City, Guizhou Province, China, in August 2023 and has been deposited in a metabolically inactive state in the China General Microbiological Culture Collection Center (CGMCC), Beijing, PR China. The ex-type culture has been deposited in the Japan Collection of Microorganisms (JCM), Koyadai, Japan, as JCM 36912. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the sequences of the D1/D2 domain and the ITS region of strains QFC-8, QFM-Y-5, QFM-Y-10, D5S-2, QFC-Y-4 and QFC-Y-6 are PP786676, PP786673, PP786674, PP786675, PP786677 and PP786672 and PP786670, PP786667, PP786668, PP786669, PP786671 and PP786666, respectively. The fungal name number is FN 571937.
Description of Starmerella fangiana Y.H. Wei, P.J. Han, D.Q. Wang & F.Y. Bai sp. nov.Description of Roseicyclus sediminis sp. nov.
Roseicyclus sediminis (se.dimi.nis. L. gen. n. sediminis, of sediment).

Cells are Gram-stain-negative and rod-shaped, with widths of 0.40.9 m and lengths of 1.52.6 m. Growth occurs at 2043 C (optimum, 3033 C), pH 6.09.0 (optimum, pH 6.57.5) and with 17% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2.53.5% (w/v). Facultatively anaerobic and capable of nitrate reduction. The activities of catalase, gelatin, esterase (C4), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, leucine arylamidase, oxidase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8) and valine arylamidase are positive, but alginate, starch and Tween 80 are negative. Oxidations of the sole carbon source are positive for d-fructose-6-PO4, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-glucuronic acid, glucuronamide and acetoacetic acid, while arabinose, d-melibiose, acetic acid and methyl pyruvate are negative. Acids are produced from arabinose, d-ribose, xylose, d-fructose, l-sorbose, escullin/ferric citrate (ESC), d-tagatose and 5-keto-potassium gluconate. The major cellular fatty acids (5%) consist of C18:1 7c and C16:0. The sole quinone is Q10. Major polar lipids consist of AL, PG, DPG and unidentified ALs and lipids. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.5%.

The type strain is SDUM158016T (=KCTC 92632T =MCCC 1H01367T), which was isolated from coastal sediments collected off the coast of Weihai, China. The GenBank accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequence and the whole-genome shotgun project of strain SDUM158016T are OP526358 and JAOPHT000000000, respectively.
Description of Roseicyclus sediminis sp. nov.Description of Roseicyclus salinarum sp. nov.
Roseicyclus salinarum (sa.li.narum. L. gen. pl. n. salinarum, of salterns).

Cells are Gram-stain-negative and rod-shaped with widths of 1.01.2 m and lengths of 2.24.3 m. Growth occurs at 2043 C (optimum, 3033 C), pH 6.09.0 (optimum, pH 6.57.5) and with 110% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 2.53.5% (w/v)). Facultatively anaerobic and capable of nitrate reduction. The activities of catalase, gelatin, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), oxidase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are positive, valine arylaminase are negative. Oxidations of the sole carbon source are positive for d-fructose-6-PO4, d-galacturonic acid, l-galactonic acid lactone, d-glucuronic acid, glucuronamide, d-melibiose, acetoacetic acid and acetic acid. Acids are produced from arabinose, d-ribose, d-fructose, l-sorbose, escullin/ferric citrate (ESC), d-maltose, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose and 5-keto-potassium gluconate. Acid is not produced from d-xylose and l-xylose. Major cellular fatty acids (5%) consist of C18:1 7c and C16:0. The sole quinone is Q10. The major polar lipids consist of AL, PG, DPG and unidentified ALs and lipids. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.5%.

The type strain is SDUM158017T (=KCTC 92633T =MCCC 1H01363T), which was isolated from a marine solar saltern along the Weihai coast, China. The GenBank accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequence and the whole-genome shotgun project of strain SDUM158017T are OP522343 and JARRSA000000000, respectively.
Description of Roseicyclus salinarum sp. nov.Description of Luteimonas flava sp. nov.
Luteimonas flava (flava. L. fem. adj. flava, yellow, referring to the colour of the colonies).

The cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, motile, short rod shaped, 0.50.8 m in length and 0.30.4 m in width. The colonies are convex and yellow coloured. Growth occurs at 434 C (optimum 25 C), pH 5.011.0 (optimum 7.08.0) and NaCl concentration 05.0 w/v % (optimum 1.0%). It is positive for catalase and H2S production, but negative for oxidase, nitrate reduction, indole production, VogesProskauer test, methyl red test and urease. It could hydrolyse casein and gelatin, but not agar, chitin, starch, aesculin or Tween (20, 40, 60 or 80). It could utilize d-glucose, maltose monohydrate, starch, sodium acetate anhydrous, sodium pyruvate and glycerol, but not sucrose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-lactose monohydrate, d-trehalose dihydrate, mannitol, d-sorbitol, inositol, sodium formate dihydrate, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-serine or glycine. It is positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, -glucosidase and -glucosidase and weakly positive for esterase (C4), valine arylamidase and -chymotrypsin, but negative for cystine arylamidase, -galactosidase, -galactosidase, -glucuronidase, N-acetyl--glucosaminidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase. The ubiquinone is Q8. The major fatty acids are iso-C15:0, iso-C16:0 and summed feature 9 (iso-C17:1 9c and/or C16:0 10-methyl). The polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol, one unidentified aminophospholipid and one unidentified aminolipid.

Type strain SMYT11WT (=GDMCC 1.4275T=KCTC 8304T) was isolated from a river located in Southwest China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 67.8% (genome based), and its approximate genome size is about 3.83 Mbp. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequence and draft genome are PP152361 and JAZHBM000000000, respectively.
Description of Luteimonas flava sp. nov.Description of Aquilutibacter gen. nov.
Aquilutibacter (A.qui.lu.ti.bacter. L. fem. n. aqua, water; L. neut. n. lutum, mud; N.L. masc. n. bacter, a rod; N.L. masc. n. Aquilutibacter, related to the isolation source of the type species).

The cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, motile and short rod shaped. It is positive for catalase and oxidase. The ubiquinone is Q8. The major fatty acids are iso-C15:0, iso-C16:0 and summed feature 9 (iso-C17:1 9c and/or C16:0 10-methyl). The predominant polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol and two unidentified phospholipids. The type species is Aquilutibacter rugosus.
Description of Aquilutibacter gen. nov.Description of Aquilutibacter rugosus sp. nov.
Aquilutibacter rugosus (ru.gosus. L. masc. adj. rugosus, wrinkled, referring to the wrinkled surface of the colonies).

The cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, motile, short rod shaped, 0.51.0 m in length and 0.40.5 m in width. The colonies are creamy, mucoid and sometimes like the wrinkled skin. Growth occurs at 437 C (optimum 25 C), pH 4.510.0 (optimum 7.08.0) and NaCl concentration 01.0 w/v % (optimum 0%). It is positive for catalase, oxidase, indole production and H2S production, but negative for nitrate reduction, VogesProskauer test, methyl red test and urease. It could not hydrolyse agar, chitin, casein, gelatin, starch, aesculin or Tween (20, 40, 60 or 80). It could utilize d-glucose, maltose monohydrate, starch, sodium pyruvate and l-glutamic acid, but not sucrose, d-fructose, d-galactose, mannitol, d-sorbitol, sodium formate dihydrate or glycerol. It is positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and -glucosidase and weakly positive for esterase (C4) and valine arylamidase, but negative for cystine arylamidase, -chymotrypsin, -galactosidase, -galactosidase, -glucuronidase, -glucosidase, N-acetyl--glucosaminidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase. The ubiquinone is Q8. The major fatty acids are iso-C15:0, iso-C16:0 and summed feature 9 (iso-C17:1 9c and/or C16:0 10-methyl). The polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol, two unidentified phospholipids, one unidentified aminophospholipid and one unidentified aminolipid.

Type strain FXH3WT (=GDMCC 1.4096T=KCTC 8154T) was isolated from a deep lake located in Southwest China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.9% (genome based), and its approximate genome size is about 2.11 Mbp. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene sequence and draft genome are PP152359 and JAZHBO000000000, respectively.

Montanilutibacter (Mon.ta.ni.lu.ti.bacter. L. masc. adj. montanus, of a mountain; L. neut. n. lutum, mud; N.L. masc. n. bacter, a rod; N.L. masc. n. Montanilutibacter, a mud-dwelling rod from a mountain).

Aerolutibacter ruishenii (rui.sheni.i. N.L. gen. n. ruishenii, of Rui-Shen, in honour of Rui-Shen Jiao, a respected Chinese microbiologist, for his enormous contributions to the development of microbiology in China).

Description of Aerolutibacter ruishenii comb. nov.Description of Dyadobacter helix sp. nov.
Dyadobacter helix (helix. L. fem. n. helix, a whorl).

The cells are Gram-reaction-negative, curved rods (0.51.0 m) in pairs and helices (around 12 m long). Non motile. Colonies in R2A medium are mucous and yellow pigmented. Flexirubin pigment reaction to KOH is positive. Oxidase and catalase positive. Strictly aerobic, not able to ferment carbohydrates, not able to reduce nitrate to nitrite or N2. Mesophilic, growth is positive from 15 to 37 C but not at 4 or 40 C. Grows at 0% salinity and up to 1.5% but not at 3% or more. pH range is 5.0 to 10.0. Unable to hydrolyse casein, starch, cellulose, Tween 80 or DNA, but proteolytic on gelatin. Enzymatic activities in API ZYM are positive for alkaline and acid phosphatases, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase (weak), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, -galactosidase (weak), -galactosidase, - and -glucosidases and N-acetyl--glucosaminidase, while esterase, esterase lipase, lipase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, -chymotrypsin, -glucuronidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase are negative. Positive for aesculin and gelatin hydrolysis and p-nitrophenyl -d-glucopyranoside test (-galactosidase) and assimilation of N-acetyl glucosamine, glucose, mannose and maltose in API 20NE, but negative for nitrate reduction, glucose fermentation, indole production from tryptophan, arginine dihydrolase and urease. Weak acidification of galactose, glucose, fructose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, turanose and lyxose in aerobic API 50CH/E. Growth in the minimal medium is positive only with yeast extract (positive control) and with l-tryptophan, out of 29 sole carbon sources tested. The main cellular fatty acids are iso C15:0 and summed feature 3 (C16:1 7c/C16:1 6c). G+C content of its DNA is 45.4%.

The type strain is AB1T (=CECT 9275T=LMG 32341T), isolated from a drinking water treatment plant in Barcelona (Spain). The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene and genome sequences of the type strain are PQ072836 and CAJRAF01, respectively.
Description of Dyadobacter helix sp. nov.Description of Dyadobacter linearis sp. nov.
Dyadobacter linearis (li.ne.aris. L. masc. adj. linearis, linear).

The cells are rods (0.51.01.03.0 m), Gram-reaction-negative, mostly in pairs or rarely in linear chains. Non motile. Colonies on R2A medium are mucous and bright yellow. Pigment is flexirubin type, according to the KOH test. Oxidase and catalase positive. Strictly aerobic. Mesophilic, neutrophilic and non-halophilic, growing in the following ranges: 1537 C, 5.5 to 10 pH and from 0 to 1.5% NaCl. Nitrate reduction to nitrite or gas is negative. Glucose is not fermented. Negative for hydrolysis of starch, cellulose, casein, gelatin, Tween 80 and DNA. Negative for urease, indole production from tryptophan and arginine dihydrolase. Positive for -galactosidase, aesculin hydrolysis and delayed assimilation of glucose, maltose, mannitol and N-acetyl-d-glucosamine (API 20NE). Enzymatic activities detected in API ZYM include alkaline phosphatase, leucine and valine arylamidases, - and -galactosidases, - and -glucosidases and N-acetyl--glucosaminidase. A weak response is obtained for acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and -mannosidase. Esterase, esterase lipase, lipase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, -chymotrypsin, -glucuronidase and -fucosidase are negative. Weak acidification of the following carbohydrates is observed in API 50CH/E strips incubated aerobically: glucose, methyl -d-mannopyranoside, methyl -d-glucopyranoside, N-acetyl d-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose and sucrose, in addition to a strong positive reaction in aesculin. Unable to grow on any of the 30 sole carbon sources assayed in minimal medium, including yeast extract, suggesting that it has non-identified growth factor requirements.

The type strain is AB67T (=CECT 9623T=LMG 32342T), isolated from a drinking water distribution network in Tona (Barcelona, Spain). The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene and genome sequences of the type strain are PQ069724 and CAJRAU01, respectively.
Description of Dyadobacter linearis sp. nov.Description of Kosakonia calanthes sp. nov.
Kosakonia calanthes (ca.lan'thes. N.L. gen. n. calanthes of Calanthe, the plant Calanthe triplicata from which the type strain was isolated).

Colonies are transparent, round protrusions with a moist surface and have a diameter of ~1.22.5 mm after 96 h of incubation at 30  on TSB agar. The cells are Gram-stain-negative, facultative anaerobic, motile, catalase-positive, oxidase-negative and rod-shaped (~1.32.9 m in length and 0.40.6 m in width). Growth occurs at pH 4.010.0 and temperatures ranging from 4  to 45  with a NaCl concentration of 07% (w/v), while optimal growth is observed at pH 8.0 and a temperature of 37  with a NaCl concentration of 01% (w/v). It shows a positive result for the MR test. Fermentation occurs from d-mannitol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl--xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl--d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin ferric citrate, salicin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, d-lactose, d-melibiose, d-trehalose, xylitol, d-gentiobiose, d-lyxose, d-fucose, d-arabitol, d-sucrose, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate but not from l-sorbose, methyl--d-mannopyranoside, inulin, d-turanose, d-tagatose, l-arabitol and inositol. A weak fermentation occurs from erythritol, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, starch and glycogen. It shows positive reactions for arginine dihydrolase, -galactosidase and gelatinase but negative reactions for citrate utilization, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase and H2S production. It also tests positive for the VP reaction but negative for indole production and urea hydrolysis. The polar lipids include unidentified lipids (L), PL, PE, PG and APL. The major fatty acids consist of C16:0, sum of C16:1 7c/C16:1 6c, C17 : 0 cyclo and C18:1 7c.

The type strain CCTCC AB 2023082T (=JCM 36393T) was isolated from the leaves of C. triplicata. The DNA G+C content of strain CCTCC AB 2023082T is 54.2 mol%. The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain CCTCC AB 2023082T is OR177835, while the genome can be accessed through the GenBank with the accession number CP151800.
Description of Kosakonia calanthes sp. nov.Description of Kodamaea schenbergiae Santa-Brigida, A. R. O. Santos, M. B. Martins, L. H. Rosa, M. A. Lachance & C. A. Rosa sp. nov.

Kodamaea schenbergiae (schen.bergi.ae. N.L. gen. n. schenbergiae, of Schenberg, in honour of Ana Clara Guerrini Schenberg, in recognition of her contributions to the study of yeast genetics and biotechnology in Brazil).

On YM agar, after 3 days at 25 C, cells are ovoid to elongate (24511 m) and occur singly or in pairs (Fig. 3). Budding is multilateral. Colonies are convex, white to cream-coloured, with an entire margin. In yeast extract (0.5%)-glucose (2%) broth after 14 days, sediment is formed, and a pellicle and a ring are observed. In Dalmau plate culture after 2 weeks on cornmeal agar, pseudohyphae with blastoconidia are formed but not true mycelia. Asci or signs of conjugation are not seen on sporulation media. Fermentation of glucose is negative. Glucose, raffinose, melibiose (variable), trehalose (variable), maltose (variable), melezitose (variable), cellobiose (variable), salicin (variable/weak), sorbose (variable), xylose (positive slow), ethanol (variable), glycerol (variable), ribitol (variable), mannitol, glucitol (variable), succinate (variable), citrate (variable/weak) and N-cetyl-d-glucosamine (variable/slow) are assimilated as sole carbon sources. Inulin, sucrose, galactose, lactose, soluble starch, rhamnose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, ribose, methanol, erythritol, galactitol, myo-inositol, dl-lactate, d-gluconate, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, hexadecane, xylitol, 2-propanol, acetone and ethylacetate are not assimilated. l-Lysine is assimilated as the sole nitrogen source. Nitrate and nitrite are not assimilated. Growth is not observed at 37 C. Growth in the presence of 0.01% cycloheximide, 10% NaCl plus 5% glucose and 1% acetic acid is negative. Growth in 50% glucose/yeast extract (0.5%) is negative. Acid production is variable. Growth in the amino-acid-free medium is positive. Starch-like compounds are not produced. The habitat is fungal fruiting bodies and drosophilid guts collected in the Amazonian ecosystem in Brazil. The holotype CBS 18628 is preserved in a metabolically inactive state in the CBS Yeast Collection of the Westerdijk Fungal Diversity Institute, Utrecht, the Netherlands. It was isolated from the surface of Drosophila sp. on Lentinula raphanica collected in Caxiuan National Forest, Amazonian ecosystem, Par state, Brazil. An isotype (metabolically inactive) of Kodamaea schenbergiae sp. nov. is deposited in the Collection of Microorganisms and Cells of Federal University of Minas Gerais (Coleo de Microrganismos e Clulas da Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais, UFMG), Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, Brazil, as strain UFMG-CM-Y6360. The MycoBank number is MB855624. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the ITS-5.8S region and the D1/D2 domains of the large subunit rRNA gene sequences for strain UFMG-CM-Y6360 are OQ029640 and MG857090.

Description of Kodamaea schenbergiae Santa-Brigida, A. R. O. Santos, M. B. Martins, L. H. Rosa, M. A. Lachance & C. A. Rosa sp. nov.Description of Suhomyces schwaniae R. Santa-Brigida, A. R. O. Santos, M. B. Martins, L. H. Rosa, M. A. Lachance & C. R. Rosa sp. nov.

Suhomyces schwaniae (sch.wani.ae. N.L. gen. n. schwaniae, of Schwan, in honour of Rosane de Freitas Schwan, in recognition of her contributions to the study of yeasts associated with fermentations and natural substrates in Brazil).

On YM agar after 3 days at 25 C, the cells are globose to ovoid (2415 m m) and occur singly or in pairs (Fig. 4). Budding is multilateral. Colonies are small, convex and greyish-white and have an entire margin. In yeast extract (0.5%)-glucose (2%) broth after 14 days, a sediment is formed, but no pellicle or ring was observed. In Dalmau plates after 2 weeks on cornmeal agar, pseudohyphae with clusters of blastoconidia are formed. Asci or signs of conjugation were not seen on sporulation media. Fermentation of glucose is positive. Assimilation of carbon compounds is as follows: glucose, galactose, maltose (variable), sucrose (variable), cellobiose, trehalose, raffinose, melezitose (variable), d-arabinose (variable/weak), ethanol, glycerol, erythritol (variable), ribitol, d-mannitol, d-glucitol, salicin, dl-lactate (variable/weak), succinate, citrate (variable), myo-inositol (variable/weak), glucosamine (variable), xylitol (variable), ethylacetate (variable), d-gluconate (slow) and N-acetyl-d-glucosamine (slow) are positive. Growth is negative on l-sorbose, lactose, melibiose, inulin, soluble starch, d-xylose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, l-rhamnose, galactitol, methanol, hexadecane, acetone and 2-propanol. Assimilation of nitrogen compounds is as follows: positive for lysine and negative for nitrate and nitrite. Growth in the amino-acid-free medium is positive. Growth at 37 C is variable and negative at 40 C. Growth in 1% acetic acid is negative. Growth on YM agar with 10% sodium chloride is negative. Growth in 50% glucose/yeast extract (0.5%) is negative. Acid production is weak. Starch-like compounds are not produced. In 100 g cycloheximide ml1, growth is variable. Urease activity is negative. Diazonium blue B reaction is negative. The here-designated holotype CBS 18800 is preserved in a metabolically inactive state in the CBS Yeast Collection of the Westerdijk Fungal Diversity Institute, Utrecht, the Netherlands. It was isolated from a fruit fly gut collected feeding on the surface of a Nigrofomes melanoporus fruiting body, in Caxiuan National Forest, state of Par, Brazil. An isotype (metabolically inactive) of Suhomyces schwaniae sp. nov. is deposited in the Collection of Microorganisms and Cells of Federal University of Minas Gerais (Coleo de Microrganismos e Clulas da Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais, UFMG), Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, Brazil, as strain UFMG-CM-Y6429. The MycoBank number is MB855625. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the ITS-5.8S region and the D1/D2 domains of the large subunit rRNA gene sequences for strain UFMG-CM-Y6429 are PP980957 and MH627220.
Description of Suhomyces schwaniae R. Santa-Brigida, A. R. O. Santos, M. B. Martins, L. H. Rosa, M. A. Lachance & C. R. Rosa sp. nov.Description of Plantactinospora soli sp. nov.
Plantactinospora soli (soli, L. gen. n. soli of soil, referring to the source of the type strain).

Gram-stain-positive, aerobic actinomycete forms well-developed substrate hyphae, producing single spores on the mycelium. Colonies thrive on PDA, ISP 2 and ISP 4 media; grow moderately on Czapeks agar, nutrient agar, ISP 3 and ISP 7 media; and exhibit limited growth on ISP 5 media. The optimal growth temperature is 28 C, within a range of 1537 C, and no growth at 45 C. Growth is observed in the presence of 02% (w/v) NaCl and at pH between 6 and 9, with an optimal pH of 78. Positive for casein, oxidase, catalase, milk peptonization and hydrolysis of Tween 80. Negative for starch, urease and H2S production assays. d-Galactose, d-ribose, d-fructose, d-xylose, d-mannose and cellobiose are utilized as sole carbon sources but not raffinose, d-sorbitol and inositol, l-asparagine, l-tyrosine and l-arginine are utilized as sole nitrogen sources but not l-glutamate and l-alanine. The cell wall is identified to comprise meso-diaminopimelic acid, with the principal constituents of whole-cell hydrolysates being xylose, mannose, glucose and galactose. The dominant menaquinones are characterized as MK-10(H6) and MK-10(H4). The diagnostic phospholipids consist of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylinositol. The genome spans a total length of 10 264 578 bp with a high genomic DNA G+C content of 71.6 mol%. Biosynthetic gene clusters within the genome, such as tryptophan and isoprenoid gene clusters, have been confirmed to possess the remarkable capability of synthesizing hormones that promote plant growth. The type strain is KLBMP 9567T (= CGMCC 4.7773T = NBRC 115787T), which was isolated from karstic areas of Guizhou Province, China. The GenBank accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene and genome sequences of strain KLBMP 9567T are ON693950 and JAWQRR000000000, respectively.
Description of Plantactinospora soli sp. nov.Description of Pseudomonas machongensis sp. nov.
Pseudomonas machongensis (ma.chong.ensis. N.L. fem. adj. machongensis, pertaining to Machong Town, Guangdong, China, the geographical origin of the type strain).

Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, motile and rod-shaped (1.22.2 m long, 0.80.9 m wide). The colonies are white, circular, smooth and the edges are regular after incubation on LB broth at 28 for 2 days. Growth occurs at 442 C (optimum, 28), pH 4.010.0 (optimum, pH 5.0) and with 06% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 0%). Catalase and oxidase activities are both positive. Biolog GEN III Microplate assay indicates that the cells can utilize acetic acid, bromo-succinic acid, citric acid, d-aspartic acid, d-fructose, d-fructose-6-phosphate, d-fucose, d-galactose, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid, d-glucuronic acid, d-malic acid, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-saccharic acid, d-serine, glucuronamide, l-alanine, l-arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-fucose, l-galactonic acid lactone, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-lactic acid, l-malic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, methyl pyruvate, mucic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, -d-glucose, -keto-glutaric acid and -amino-butyric acid. Cells are insensitive to aztreonam, fusidic acid, guanidine HCl, lincomycin, minocycline, nalidixic acid, niaproof 4, potassium tellurite, rifamycin sv, tetrazolium blue, tetrazolium violet, troleandomycin and vancomycin. The major cellular fatty acids are C16:0, C18:1 7c/C18:1 6c (summed feature 8), C16:1 7c/C16:1 6c (summed feature 3) and C17:0 cyclo, the respiratory quinone is Q-9, and the major polar lipids include DPG, PE, PG and an unidentified aminolipid.

The type strain, MH2T (=GDMCC 1.3750T=JCM 36318T), was isolated from C. annuum showing wilt disease symptoms collected from a farmland in Machong town, Guangdong, China. The genome has a size of 5.71 Mb and a GC-content of 63.12 mol%. The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain MH2T is PP061858; for the draft genome sequence of MH2T is JAYFUI000000000.
Description of Pseudomonas machongensis sp. nov.Description of Stenotrophomonas capsici sp. nov.
Stenotrophomonas capsici (capsi.ci. N.L. neut. gen n. capsici, referring to Capsicum, the genus name of pepper).

Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, motile and rod-shaped (1.33.2 m long, 0.50.6 m wide). Colonies are yellow, circular, smooth and edges are regular after incubation on LB at 28 for 2 days. Growth occurs at 442 C (optimum, 28), pH 4.010.0 (optimum, pH 4.0) and with 06% (w/v) NaCl (optimum, 0%). Catalase and oxidase activities are negative and positive, respectively. Biolog GEN III Microplate assay indicates that the cells can utilize acetic acid, acetoacetic acid, citric acid, d-cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, d-fructose-6-phosphate, d-fucose, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucuronic acid, d-maltose, d-mannose, d-turanose, gelatin, gentiobiose, glucuronamide, glycyl-l-proline, l-fucose, l-galactonic acid lactone, l-lactic acid, l-malic acid, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine and -d-glucose. Cells are insensitive to aztreonam, guanidine HCl, lincomycin, lithium chloride, niaproof 4, rifamycin sv, tetrazolium blue, tetrazolium violet, troleandomycin and vancomycin. The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15:0, iso-C16:0 and iso-C14:0, the respiratory quinone is Q-8, and the major polar lipids include DPG, PE, PG, as well as unidentified aminolipid, aminophospholipids, lipids and phospholipid.

The type strain, MH1T (=GDMCC 1.3749T=JCM 36317T), was isolated from C. annuum showing wilt disease symptoms collected from a farmland in Machong town, Guangdong, China. The genome has a size of 4.18 Mb and a GC-content of 67.19 mol%. The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain MH1T is PP060478; for the draft genome sequence of MH1T is JAYFUH000000000.
Description of Stenotrophomonas capsici sp. nov.Description of Methanochimaera gen. nov.

Methanochimaera (Me.tha.no.chi.maera. N.L. neut. n. methanum, methane; N.L. pref. methano-, pertaining to methane; L. fem. n. chimaera, a mythological beast possessing characteristics from different creatures; N.L. fem. n. Methanochimaera, a methane (-forming) organism with features from other creatures, referring to the uncertain systematic placement between Methanoplanus and Methanomicrobium).

Coccoid, usually 0.81.2 m in diameter. Cells lyse in dilute solutions of sodium dodecyl sulphate. Obligately anaerobic, mesophilic and produce methane from H2/CO2 and formate. The type species is Methanochimaera problematica.
Description of Methanochimaera gen. nov.Description of Methanochimaera problematica sp. nov.
Methanochimaera problematica (pro.ble.mati.ca. L. fem. adj. problematica, problematic, reflecting the challenges encountered during taxonomical placement).

Coccoid, usually 0.81.2 m in diameter, occur singly. Cells lyse in dilute solutions of sodium dodecyl sulphate. Possesses an S-layer protein with an Mr about 137.00 kDa and flagella. Produces methane from H2/CO2 and formate, but not acetate, secondary alcohols, methylamines, methanol or ethanol. Growth occurs at 2040 (optimum, 37), at pH 5.47.2 (optimum, pH 7.0) and at 00.86 M (optimum, 0.09 M). Yeast extract is required for growth.

Type strain is FWC-SCC4T (=BCRC AR10058T = NBRC 114595T), isolated from cold seep sediment at the Four-Way Closure Ridge, offshore southwestern Taiwan. The genomic G+C content of the type strain is 40.3 mol% calculated from complete genome sequence. DDBJ/EMA/GenBank accession numbers of 16S rRNA gene and complete genome sequences of strain FWC-SCC4T are MN524133.1 and CP043875, respectively.
Description of Methanochimaera problematica sp. nov.Description of Methanoeremita gen. nov.

Me.tha.no.e.remi.ta. (N.L. neut. n. methanum, methane; N.L. pref. methano-, pertaining to methane; L. masc. n. eremita, a hermit; N.L. masc. n. Methanoeremita, a methane (-producing) hermit, indicating the habitat of the type species (subterraneous aquifer) and the cryptic discovery of the genus).

Curved rods, usually 0.82.0 m in diameter. Cells lyse in dilute solution of sodium dodecyl sulphate. Obligately anaerobic, Gram-stain-negative and mesophilic. Produce methane from H2/CO2 and formate. The G+C content is around 40 mol%. The type species is Methanoeremita antiquus.
Description of Methanoeremita gen. nov.Description of Methanoeremita antiquus comb. nov.
Methanoeremita antiquus (an.tiqu.us. L. masc. adj. antiquus, old, ancient).
Basonym: Methanomicrobium antiquum Mochimaru et al. 2016.
Description of Methanoeremita antiquus comb. nov.Description of Bifidobacterium apicola sp. nov.
Bifidobacterium apicola sp. nov. (a.pi'co.la. L. fem. n. apis, bee; L. masc./fem. n. suff. -cola, dweller; from L. masc./fem. n. incola, inhabitant, dweller; N.L. masc./fem. n. apicola, bee-dweller).

Cells are Gram-stain-positive, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.40.52.02.8 m, that usually occur singly or in pairs. Colonies on mMRS agar are circular, with entire margins, smooth, convex, beige and approximately 0.2 mm in diameter after 2 days of cultivation at 37 C under strict anaerobic conditions. The growth occurs at 2540 C. The optimum growth temperature is 3037 C. The growth occurs at pH 58, but not at pH 4 or 9. The growth occurs on mMRS agar supplemented with 3% (w/v) NaCl, but not with 4% (w/v) NaCl. It is negative for gas production from glucose, gas production from gluconate, pyruvate utilization, NH3 from arginine, nitrate reduction, nitrite reduction, indole production, urease production and catalase activity. It is positive for tolerance to tellurite and H2S production. VogesProskauer reaction and hydrolysis of hippurate are strain-dependent. Acid is produced from d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, methyl -d-glucopyranoside, arbutin, salicin and melibiose. Acid is not produced from glycerol, d-adonitol, methyl -d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, l-sorbitol, methyl -d-mannopyranoside, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate or 5-keto-gluconate. Aesculin is hydrolysed. Acid production from erythritol, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, cellobiose, lactose and raffinose is strain-dependent. In the API ZYM test, it is positive for esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, -galactosidase, -glucosidase and -glucosidase; negative for alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, trypsin, -chymotrypsin, -glucuronidase, N-acetyl--glucosaminidase, -mannosidase and -fucosidase; and strain-dependent for -galactosidase. The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of the A4 l-LysD-Asp type. The major fatty acids are C16:0, C18:1 9c and sum of C19:1 6c/C19:1 7c/C19:0 cyclo 10c. The type strain is F806-1T (=CCTCC AB 2024129T=JCM 37002T), isolated from the gut of a honeybee (A. mellifera) collected in Rizhao City, Shandong Province, PR China. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.8%. The GenBank/ENA/DDBJ accession numbers for the 16S rRNA gene, clpC and draft genome sequences of strain F806-1T are LC830959, LC830960 and BAAFQP000000000, respectively.
Description of Bifidobacterium apicola sp. nov.Description of Stenotrophomonas beteli comb. nov.

Stenotrophomonas beteli (be.teli., N.L. neut. n. betelum, betel (from Malayan noun betle), referring to the original isolation from Piper betel, the betel leaf plant, of the pepper family Piperaceae; N.L. gen. n. beteli, of betel).
Basonym: Bacterium betle Ragunathan 1928 (Approved Lists 1980).
The description is the same as given by Ragunathan [70], Savulescu [71] and Sneath et al. [94] for P. beteli corrig.
The type strain is ATCC 19861T (CFBP 4337T=DSM 21257T=ICMP 2820T=LMG 978T=NCPPB 323T).
Description of Stenotrophomonas beteli comb. nov.Description of Stenotrophomonas forensis sp. nov.

Stenotrophomonas forensis (fo.rensis. L. fem. adj. forensis, public, referring to the contributions of Public Health Laboratories and the isolation of the type strain in the District of Columbia Department of Forensic Sciences laboratory).

Cells are Gram-stain-negative rods with no motility observed. Grows well at 3537 C and forms smooth 1.52.0 mm colonies on TSA after overnight incubation in aerobic conditions. Colonies are non-haemolytic and are colourless (non-lactose fermentation) on MacConkey agar. S. forensis grows in LuriaBertani medium up to concentrations of 4.0% (w/v) NaCl. S. forensis grows between pH 6 to pH 8 in trypticase soy broth. S. forensis is variable for -glucosidase and variable for lysine decarboxylase. In the Vitek 2 GN Card, S. forensis is negative for maltose utilization, trehalose utilization, malonate utilization and tyrosine arylamidase activity. S. forensis is negative for indole production from tryptophan and glucose fermentation. When assayed in the commercial API 20 NE system, cells are negative for assimilation of arabinose, d-mannose, N-acetyl-glucosamine, potassium gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid and phenylacetic acid.

Cells are positive for ala-phe-pro-arylamidase, -glucosidase, l-lactate alkalinization, -N-acetyl-glucosaminidase, lipase, glu-gly-arg-arylamidase, succinate alkalinization, citrate (sodium), -glutamyl-transferase and phosphatase. In the API 20 NE system, cells are positive for arginine dihydrolase, urease, aesculin hydrolysis, gelatinase and -galactosidase. Cells are also positive for assimilation of glucose, d-mannose, maltose, malate and trisodium citrate. The DNA G+C content is 66.5% and the type strain has a single chromosome at 4 819 725 bp in length.

The type strain of S. forensis DFS-20110405T (=ATCC TSD-272T=NCTC 14893T) was isolated from contaminated VTM. The complete genome of DFS-20110405T has been deposited into GenBank (accession number=CP082270). The 16S rRNA gene sequence is deposited under accession MZ961363.
Description of Stenotrophomonas forensis sp. nov.Description of Stenotrophomonas hibiscicola comb. nov.

Stenotrophomonas hibiscicola (hi.bis.cico.la. N.L. masc. n. Hibiscus, a botanical generic name; L. masc./fem. n. suff. -cola, inhabitant, dweller; from L. masc./fem. n. incola, dweller; N.L. fem. n. hibiscicola, Hibiscus-dweller pathogenic to Hibiscus rosa-sinensis).
Basonym: Pseudomonas hibiscicola Moniz 1963 (Approved Lists 1980).
The description is the same as given by Moniz for P. hibiscicola [73].
The type strain is ATCC 19867T (=ICMP 3945T=JCM 13361T=LMG 980T=NCPPB 1683T).
Description of Stenotrophomonas hibiscicola comb. nov.Description of Dictyobacter halimunensis sp. nov.
Dictyobacter halimunensis (ha.li.mun.ensis. N.L. masc. adj. halimunensis, refers to Halimun Mountain, West Java, Indonesia, where the type strain was isolated).

Cells are Gram-stain-positive, aerobic, catalase-positive, non-motile, filamentous and spore-forming and form putative sporangia on aerial mycelia. Growth occurs at 1537 C (optimum at 30 C), at pH 5.07.0 (optimum at pH 7.0) and with 01% NaCl on NBRC 231 medium. Hydrolyse CMC, MCC, xylan, starch and skim milk. The cell-wall sugars are xylose and mannose. The polar lipids are phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, unidentified glycolipids and unidentified phospholipids. The major menaquinone is MK-9(H2). The cell-wall amino acids are d-glutamic acid, glycine, d-alanine, l-alanine, -alanine and l-ornithine. The major fatty acids are anteiso-C17:0, iso-C17:0, C16:1 2-OH and iso-C16:1. The genome size and G+C content are 9.41 Mbp and 54.3 mol%, respectively.
The type strain, S3.2.2.5T (=UICC B-128T = CGMCC 1.61913T = KCTC 43728T), was isolated from soil inside a decayed bamboo stem in the forest near the Cisolok geysers, West Java, Indonesia.

The draft whole-genome sequences of the type strain S3.2.2.5T have been deposited in DDBJ under the accession numbers BSRI01000001-BSRI01000003, and the GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of the type strain S3.2.2.5T and other two strains are LC715230-LC715232, respectively.
Description of Dictyobacter halimunensis sp. nov.Description of Pseudomonas boreofloridensis sp. nov.

Pseudomonas boreofloridensis (bor.e.o.flor.id.ensis. Gr. masc. n. boreas, the north; N.L. fem. adj. floridensis, of or from Florida; N.L. fem. adj. boreofloridensis, pertaining to northern Florida, the geographical location of isolation).

Cells are Gram-negative motile rods (2.02.40 m in length and ~1.0 m in width) with lophotrichous flagella. Colonies are smooth, circular, light yellow in color and 2.02.5 mm in diameter when grown on NA and incubated for 48 h at 28 C. Colonies produce a diffusible fluorescent pigment when grown on Kings medium B. Strains are negative for levan production and pectolytic activity and do not elicit an HR in tobacco. They are positive for oxidase and arginine dihydrolase activities and elicit an HR in tomato. Inoculation of watermelon (C. lanatus) and squash (C. pepo subsp. pepo) seedlings with P. boreofloridensis strains did not lead to disease development. Strain K13T was observed to grow at pH 5 and 6, as well as at salinity levels of 1 and 4% NaCl, though not at 8% NaCl. Growth of isolates suspended in tryptic soy broth (Sigma-Aldrich) was assessed at incubation temperatures of 0, 4, 15, 21, 28, 32, 37 and 41 C. After 48 h of incubation, growth was observed only in cultures incubated at temperatures between 15 and 37 C, with optimal growth occurring between 21 and 32 C. The type strain, K13T (NCPPB 4759T = LMG 33364T), was isolated from watermelon foliage symptomatic for BLS of cucurbits in Florida. The NCBI GenBank accession numbers for the genome assemblies of Pseudomonas boreofloridensis sp. nov. strains are: K1, GCF_041947115.1 and K13T, GCF_030580795.1. The accession numbers for 16S rRNA gene sequences are K1, OR725067 and K13T, OR725079.1. The G+C content of strains K13T and K1 was found to be 63.49%; genome statistics for all strains are provided in Table 3.
Description of Pseudomonas boreofloridensis sp. nov.Description of Pseudomonas citrulli sp. nov.
Pseudomonas citrulli (ci.trulli. N.L. gen. n. citrulli, pertaining to the host of origin, Citrullus lanatus).

Cells are Gram-negative motile rods (1.752.25 m in length and ~0.75 m in width) with lophotrichous flagella. Colonies are smooth, circular, white-cream in color and 1.01.5 mm in diameter when grown on NA and incubated for 48 h at 28 C. Colonies produce a diffusible fluorescent pigment when grown on Kings medium B. The type strain is negative for pectolytic activity and does not elicit a hypersensitive reaction in tobacco or tomato. It is positive for levan production, oxidase activity and arginine dihydrolase activity. Inoculation of watermelon (C. lanatus) and squash (C. pepo subsp. pepo) seedlings with P. citrulli did not lead to disease development. Strain K18T was found to grow at pH 6, though not at pH 5. Additionally, the strain grew when exposed to salinity levels of 1 and 4% NaCl, though not at 8% NaCl. Growth of isolates suspended in tryptic soy broth (Sigma-Aldrich) was assessed at incubation temperatures of 0, 4, 15, 21, 28, 32, 37 and 41 C. After 48 h of incubation, growth was observed only in cultures incubated at temperatures between 15 and 37 C, with optimal growth occurring between 21 and 32 C. The type strain, K18T (NCPPB 4761T = LMG 33365T), was isolated from watermelon foliage symptomatic for BLS of cucurbits in Florida. The NCBI GenBank accession number for the genome assembly of Pseudomonas citrulli sp. nov. K18T is GCF_030580855.1. The accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain K18T is OR725083. The G-C content of strain K18T was found to be 62.83%; genome statistics for all strains are provided in Table 3.
Description of Pseudomonas citrulli sp. nov.Description of Sanguibacter biliveldensis sp. nov.

Sanguibacter biliveldensis (bi.li.vel.densis. N.L. masc. adj. biliveldensis., pertaining to bilivelda, Bielefeld, a city in the Ostwestfalen-Lippe Region in the north-east of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany).

API 50 CH: positive for l-arabinose, ribose, d-xylose, galactose, glucose, fructose, mannose, -methyl-glucoside, amygdalin, arbutin, escutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentibiose, d-turanose. Negative for glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-xylose, adonitol, -methyl-d-xyloside, sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, -methyl-d-mannoside, N-acetylglucosamine, inulin, melizitose, xylitol, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate, 5-keto-gluconate. Weak for d-lyxose.

API ID32 Staph: Positive for aesculin hydrolysis, glucose fermentation, fructose fermentation, mannose fermentation, maltose fermentation, trehalose fermentation, raffinose fermentation, beta-galactosidase, arginine arylamidase, saccharose fermentation, turanose fermentation, arabinose fermentation. Negative for urease, arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase, lactose fermentation, mannitol fermentation, nitrate reduction, alkaline phosphatase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, novobiocin resistance, N-acetyl-glucosamine fermentation, beta-glucuronidase.

VITEK 2 GP: positive for d-xylose, -galactosidase, -glucosidase, -mannosidase, leucin-arylamidase, l-prolin-arylamidase, -galactosidase, l-pyrrolydonyl-arylamidase, alanin-arylamidase, tyrosin-arylamidase, d-galactose, d-ribose, d-mannose, methyl--d-glucopyranoside, d-raffinose, saccharose, optochin-resistance. Negative for d-amygdalin, phosphatidylinositol-phospholipase c, arginine-dehydrolase 1, ala-phe-pro-arylamidase, cyclodextrin, l-aspartat-arylamidase, beta-galactopyranosidase, phosphatase, beta-glucuronidase, d-sorbit, urease, polymyxin-B-resistance, l-lactate-alkalinization, lactose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maltose, bacitracin-resistance, novobiocin-resistance, d-mannitol, pullulan, O/129-resistance, salicin, d-trehalose, arginin-dehydrolase 2.

Cells grown in TSB are short rods, 1.13.30.5 m, motile and non-spore-forming. Cells stain Gram-positive and are catalase-positive, oxidase-negative and pyrase-positive. Cells grow between 10 C and 35 C, with an optimum at 25 C. pH range is between 5.5 and 9.6, with an optimum at 8.09.0. Salt tolerance is between 0.5% and 4.0% with an optimum at 1.0%. Cells grow under aerobic and anaerobic conditions.

Cells were isolated from necrotic lesions of Acer tree leaves. The circular genome comprises 4.3 Mbp with a G+C content of 70.78%. All raw sequence data as well as the assembled and annotated genome are available via BioProject PRJNA938763.

Sequences, annotations and genome assembly data of the novel strain Sanguibacter biliveldensis are available at GenBank: genome sequence: CP138359; 16S rRNA sequence: PP848148; raw data SRA: PRJNA938763. Cultures of this new strain were sent to two public culture collections. Culture certificate accession numbers in line with the requirements of the Prokaryotic Code, following the meeting of the ICSP in 2002 were Leibniz-Institut DSMZ-Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH (DSMZ), DSM 117505 and Belgian Co-ordinated collection of microorganisms (BCCM-LMG): LMG 33571.

The novel species of the genus Sanguibacter described here, proposed to be named Sanguibacter biliveldensis sp. nov., is a potential plant pathogen that might serve as a model organism for plant pathology involving necrotic lesions. Furthermore, it could be an ecological stress sensor, revealing potential stressors to plant leaves through its presence.
Description of Sanguibacter biliveldensis sp. nov.Description of Yamadazyma oleae f.a. sp. nov. M. Avesani, G. Zapparoli, S. Jindamorakot, S. Limtong
Yamadazyma oleae (o.leae. L. gen. n. oleae, of the olive tree, of the genus Olea).

After 1 week at 25 C on YM agar, the colony is whitish, lucid and convex and has an entire margin which became filamentous after 2 weeks. The yeast cells are globose to subglobose (2.6524 m) (Fig. 2a). Pseudohyphae are formed in YM, ME and PDA (Fig. 2b). True hyphae are not observed during 4 weeks on YM, ME and PDA at 25 C. Asci and signs of conjugation are not observed on Gorodkowa and McClary agar.

Fermentation of glucose, galactose and trehalose are positive. Sucrose, maltose, lactose, raffinose, melibiose, cellobiose and xylose are not fermented. Carbon compounds, glucose, sucrose, galactose, maltose, melezitose, cellobiose (latent and weak), sorbose, xylose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose (latent and weak), ribose (latent), mannose, trehalose, ethanol, glycerol, erythritol, xylitol, mannitol, sorbitol, succinate, citrate, malate (latent) and glucosamine (weak), are assimilated. No growth occurs on inulin, raffinose, melibiose, lactose, soluble starch, rhamnose, isopropanol, galactitol, myo-inositol and glucono-1,5-lactone. Nitrogen compounds, ethylamine, cadaverine and lysine, are assimilated. No growth occurs on potassium nitrate, creatinine, tryptophane, creatine and imidazole.

Growth occurs on 10% NaCl with 5% glucose (weak) and 50% glucose. Growth is observed at 15, 20, 25, 30 and 37 C. No growth is observed on vitamin-free medium, 0.01 and 0.1% cycloheximide and 1% acetic acid. Positive to acid production.

The holotype CBS 18661T was isolated by M. Avesani and G. Zapparoli from olive paste sampled in an olive oil mill in Bardolino, Verona province, northeast of Italy, in November 2023 (original number OCS21) and has been permanently preserved in a metabolically inactive state in the culture collection of the Westerdijk Fungal Biodiversity Institute (WI-KNAM collection), Utrecht (The Netherlands). The isotype culture has been deposited in the culture collection of Perugia of the Department of Agricultural, Food and Environmental Sciences of the University of Perugia (Italy), as DBVPG 8076T. The other strain of the new species (original number OAV11) has also been deposited in WI-KNAM and DBVPG collection, as CBS 18662 and DBVPG 8074, respectively.

The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the D1/D2 domains and the ITS regions sequences of the holotype CBS 18661 are PP375117 and PP391581, respectively. The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the D1/D2 domains and the ITS regions sequences of strain CBS 18662 are PP375118 and PP391582, respectively. The MycoBank number of Yamadazyma oleae f.a. sp. nov. is MB 854683.

Description of Yamadazyma oleae f.a. sp. nov. M. Avesani, G. Zapparoli, S. Jindamorakot, S. LimtongDescription of Yamadazyma molendinolei f.a. sp. nov. M. Avesani, G. Zapparoli, S. Jindamorakot, S. Limtong
Yamadazyma molendinolei (mo.len.din.ole.i. L. neut. n. molendinum, a milling place, mill-house; L. neut. n. oleum, oil; N.L. gen. n. molendinolei, of mill-house oil).

After 1 week at 25 C on YM agar, the colony is whitish, lucid and convex and has an entire margin which became filamentous after 2 weeks. The yeast cells are subglobose to ellipsoidal (251.64.6 m) (Fig. 3a). Pseudohyphae are formed in YM, ME and PDA (Fig. 3b). True hyphae are not observed during 4 weeks on YM, ME and PDA at 25. Asci have not been observed Gorodkowa and McClary agar.

Fermentation of glucose and galactose is positive. Sucrose, maltose, lactose, raffinose, cellobiose, trehalose, melibiose and xylose are not fermented. Carbon compounds, glucose, sucrose, raffinose, melibiose, galactose, maltose, melezitose, cellobiose, xylose, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, ribose, mannose, ethanol (weak), glycerol, erythritol, xylitol, mannitol, sorbitol, succinate, citrate (latent and weak) and glucosamine (weak), are assimilated. No growth occurs on inulin, lactose, soluble starch, sorbose, rhamnose, trehalose, isopropanol, galactitol, myo-inositol, glucono-1,5-lactone and malate. Nitrogen compounds, ethylamine, cadaverine and lysine (weak), are assimilated. No growth occurs on potassium nitrate, creatinine, tryptophane, creatine and imidazole.

Growth occurs on 10% NaCl with 5% glucose (weak) and 50% glucose. Growth is observed at 15, 20, 25 and 30 C, but not at 37 C. No growth is observed in vitamin-free medium, 0.01 and 0.1% cycloheximide, and in 1% acetic acid. Positive to acid production.

The holotype CBS 18660T was isolated by M. Avesani and G. Zapparoli from olive oil sampled in an olive oil mill in Cavaion Veronese, Verona province, northeast of Italy, in November 2023 (original number CO-CAV2) and has been permanently preserved in a metabolically inactive state in the culture collection of the Westerdijk Fungal Biodiversity Institute (WI-KNAM collection), Utrecht (The Netherlands). The isotype culture was deposited in the culture collection of Perugia of the Department of Agricultural, Food and Environmental Sciences of the University of Perugia (Italy), as DBVPG 8075T.

The GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ accession numbers for the D1/D2 domains and the ITS regions sequences of the holotype CBS 18660 are PP130150 and PP149061, respectively. The MycoBank number of Y. molendinolei f.a. sp. nov. is MB 854684.
